=== (*) Notes and recipes ===

==== Graphic acceleration ====
* '''Gutsy:''' 3D has bugs due Intel X3100 driver (opengl z buffer error / crashes) https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/mesa/+bug/120834.

==== Compiz/Beryl ====
* '''Gutsy:''' Desktop effects doesn't work out of the box (blacklisted driver due lacking Xv support).

==== Audio ====
* '''Gutsy:''' Sound doesn't work by default.

==== Videocamera ====
* '''Gutsy:''' Webcam does work but the 'video4linux 2' drivers aren't supported in much applications (yet).

==== Wireless NIC ====
Automatically offered driver doesn't run well.

# With Synaptic, install the package "build-essential"
# Check if Ubuntu has already detected and enabled the Atheros drivers that come with repositories, with the tool for ''restricted hardware drivers'' (jockey). Disable all elements related with Atheros.
# Download a different MadWifi package from http://snapshots.madwifi.org/madwifi-hal-0.10.5.6-current.tar.gz
# With a console, move to the directory where have downloaded the new MadWifi package
# '''sudo tar -xzvf madwifi-hal-0.10.5.6-current.tar.gz'''
# '''cd madwifi-hal-0.10.5.6-current/'''
# '''sudo make'''
# Install the new specific driver: '''sudo make install'''
# Restart the computer.
# Open again the ''restricted drivers manager'' (jockey) and enable only the wireless support for Atheros. Leave "Atheros Hardware Access Layer - HAL" disabled.

Note: The task to download the MadWifi package does not work while there is no such file on internet.

==== Toucpad ====
* By default the pointer moves very slow.
